results.title: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: VicHealth, ACMI Digital Storytelling, Natasha Craig, Troy Lovett, Chris Mansfield, Daniel McCrimmon, Brian Beckhurst, Misty Briggs, Joel Atkinson, Tammy-Lee Atkinson, Helen Atkinson and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nine stories of the lives of students from Shepparton’s A.S.H.E (Academy of Sport, Health and Education), as created by the students as part of ACMI’s Digital Storytelling program. These students, also members of the Indigenous community, tell of their loves, ambitions and, mostly, of the family that support and sustain them.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : life stories from A.S.H.E (Shepparton) : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karen Milward, Norman Terrick, Linda Kennedy-Baxter, Emily Yarram, Daphne Yarram, Bindie Jack, Bess Yarram, Ben Yarram, Barbara Tilley, Amy Dowd and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ten members of the Gippsland Indigenous community share their stories. The stories, while biographical in form, are mostly centred on the theme of family, of belonging in a community and how both these things contribute to a sense of identity.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Pitch Black Heist
results.creator_credit: Gerardine O'Flynn, John Maclean, Film4, UK Film Council and DMC Film
results.brief_description: Liam (Liam Cunningham) and Michael (Michael Fassbender) are professional safe crackers who meet on a simple job to relieve an office safe from its contents. The catch is a light-activated alarm system.

results.title: Pitch black = Nightfall
results.creator_credit: Tom Engelman, Universal Pictures and David Twohy
results.brief_description: Pitch black is a futuristic science fiction thriller filmed on location outside Coober Pedy, Australia. It includes Australian actors Radha Mitchell, Lewis Fitz-Gerald, Claudia Black, and John Moore. The story begins with a spacecraft crashing onto an unknown plant. The few that have survived must band together in an attempt to live through the unknown dangers the plant hides. Initially, the group’s concerns are for water, shelter and the threat of murderer, Riddick (Vin Diesel), who has also survived the crash. However, when one of the group is killed and its leader, Fry (Radha Mitchell), is nearly killed also, the group concedes they must enlist the help of Riddick in order to survive. Still unsure of what the new danger is, the group prepares themselves as best they can, only to find when night falls that nothing could have prepared them for what comes out of the darkness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Engelman, Universal Pictures and David Twohy

results.title: Pistol opera
results.creator_credit: DENTSU, Eisei Gekijo Company, Ogura Jimusyo, Shochiku, Television Tokyo Channel 12, Katashima Ikki, Satoru Ogura and Seijun Suzuki
results.brief_description: In the late 60s, Seijun Suzuki developed a cult following with his re-envisioning of B-grade Japanese gangster flicks, defying the tropes of the genre with his desultory approach to narrative and imaginative stylistics. Here, freed of convention, Suzuki explores the possibilities of his art with astoundingly colourful and inventive vignettes that track the movements of Miyuki Minazuki, (also known as stray cat) a beautiful female assassin who dresses in black (with heels) and is determined to be number one amid her peers. This quest requires her to face down her many formidable foes and do battle, depicted in a series of extraordinarily beautiful tableaux. Stray cat must also deal with her lover and boss, a mysterious woman with whom she shares an explosive relationship. Absurdist and dreamily hallucinatory filmmaking, investigates shadowy, irrational aspects of desire. Somewhere between a remake and a sequel to Suzuki’s own cult movie “Branded to Kill” (1967). Cast includes Makiko Esumi, Sayoko Yamaguchi, Kan Hanae, Masatoshi Nagase, Mikijiro Hira, Kirin Kiki.

results.title: Pisa: story of a cathedral square = Storia di una piazza: la piazza di Pisa
results.creator_credit: Romor Film, Este Film and Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti
results.brief_description: Spanning three centuries in construction, 1000 to 1300 AD, buildings of Cathedral Square in Pisa were planned to beautify an important sea-port. The relationship between the Cathedral, the Baptistry, the leaning tower and the Campo Santo is emphasised by the photography.
results.title_for_label: Pisa: story of a cathedral square = Storia di una piazza: la piazza di Pisa

results.title: Pirates of Spring Cove
results.creator_credit: Alan Brown, Duota Rentals and Richard Thorpe
results.brief_description: Hayley Mills and John Mills star in this family pleaser that has adventure, piracy, buried treasure and romance. An American widower and his 18 year old daughter live on a Caribbean houseboat. When they invite the nephew of a millionaire to join them on their voyage, romance and action hop on board too. The nephew’s former business partner arrives and together they embark on a dive to discover buried treasure. James MacArthur (Hawaii Five-O) co stars. Also known as “The Truth about Spring”, after Hayley Mills’ character, Spring Tyler.

results.title: Pirate ship
results.creator_credit: Paul Terry, Castle Films and Frank Moser
results.brief_description: Short animation with some live action and songs. A gang of pirates hold s young damsel hostage. She is rescued when the US navy sends a convoy of warships to destroy the pirates. They then sing a tribute to the glorious red, white and blue. Story is framed by having two characters of indeterminate species reading the story of the pirate ship. The female asks the male if he would rescue her they way the story hero recused the damsel. He says he would.

results.title: Pippa passes = The Song of conscience
results.brief_description: Pippa’s singing it seems, has a magical healing effect on those who cross her path. Based on a Robert Browning poem, “Pippa Passes” has a time-based four-part structure and expressive simulation of early morning light. Cast includes Gertrude Robinson, George Nichols, Linda Arvidson, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.
